description: Triangle T(n,k), n >= 1, giving number of prime unoriented alternating links with n crossings and k components.
comments: A link is a not necessarily connected knot. Apart from the initial rows, the n-th row contains floor(n/2) terms.
references: Ortho Flint, Bruce Fontaine and Stuart Rankin, The master array of a prime alternating link, preprint, 2007
links: Stuart Rankin (srankin(AT)uwo.ca), Nov 05 2007, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..133
S. R. Finch, Knots, links and tangles
Ortho Flint, Bruce Fontaine and Stuart Rankin, Enumerating the prime alternating links, preprint, 2007.
Ortho Flint and Stuart Rankin, Enumerating the prime alternating links, Journal of Knot theory and its Ramifications, 13 (2004), 151-173.
S. Rankin and O. Flint Knot theory web page.
M. B. Thistlethwaite, Numbers of knots and links with up to 19 crossings
Index entries for sequences related to knots
example: First few rows of irregular triangle are:   0   0  1   1   1  1   2  1   3  3  2   7  6  1  18 14  6 1  41 42 12 1  ...
crossrefs: First column gives numbers of knots, A002864. Second column gives A059741. Row sums give A049344.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 10 2001
extensions: Terms for the 20, 21, 22 and 23 crossing prime alternating links (see the b-file) added Nov 03 2007 by Stuart Rankin, Ortho Flint and Bruce Fontaine
Trailing 0 in row for n=2 removed by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 21 2007
